This creates a probe stock of  . To minimise freeze thaw cycles  make small aliquots and store them at   ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":75,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":156,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":229,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"287j7","text":"Prepare   1xPBS using nuclease free 10x PBS and nuclease free water.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":8,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3m66b","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6mg9f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"kcng","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7c64n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"400","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"12.5","error_concentration":false,"guid":"D89EBAF01EF711EDB17B3FB1647CE606","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":29}},"2":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"FC6339701EF711EDB17B3FB1647CE606","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-20","unit":10}},"3":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"50","error":false,"guid":"0E2DAAF01EF811EDB17B3FB1647CE606","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"98eef","text":"Single molecule RNA FISH (smRNA FISH) is an imaging method that labels individual mRNA molecules in cells to facilitate localization and quantitative studies. Here we present a modified protocol for mRNA labelling in Arabidopsis root meristem cells that retains GFP fluorescence. Although the processing steps impact GFP intensity, this protocol demonstrates visualization of RNA together with highly expressed protein. This protocol is presented together with simplified image analysis steps that aim to support inexperienced cell biologists through from experimental set up to mRNA quantification.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

forks.title: PROTRAN-FISH: RNA imaging in Arabidopsis Root Protoplasts

guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"53fok","text":"When performing Stellaris RNA FISH, it is imperative to limit RNA degradation. You should try to ensure that all consumables and reagents are RNase-free.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

references.title: Fiji: an open-source platform for biological-image analysis.
references.authors: Schindelin J, Arganda-Carreras I, Frise E, Kaynig V, Longair M, Pietzsch T, Preibisch S, Rueden C, Saalfeld S, Schmid B, Tinevez JY, White DJ, Hartenstein V, Eliceiri K, Tomancak P, Cardona A

references.title: Single Molecule RNA FISH in Arabidopsis Root Cells.
references.authors: Duncan S, Olsson TSG, Hartley M, Dean C, Rosa S

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ap2f","text":"Sterilize then sow a row of Col-0 Arabidopsis seeds onto half strength Murashige and Skoog Medium (1/2 MS) near the top of a 10 cm square petri plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fh34v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5d6c6","text":"Stratify the seeds at  for two days. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":22,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"480jq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"2F2165F01EE711EDB17B3FB1647CE606","id":0,"label":"in a cold room","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"630gs","text":"Take the plate out of the cold and place it vertically in a growth cabinet set for 16 hours light and 8 hours dark at a constant    (a plate holder can be useful to ensure stability).  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":129,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"119q3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"8AB882E01EE711EDB17B3FB1647CE606","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"20","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1smfd","text":"Prepare    4% fixative in a 3 cm petri dish by diluting   of 16% methanol free formaldehyde in    of 1x PBS. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":8,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":56,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":96,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cirqi","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"chubc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"685dl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"4","error":false,"guid":"3D90B3A01EE911EDB17B3FB1647CE606","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"B88ADBA01EE711EDB17B3FB1647CE606","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"3","error":false,"guid":"C14B00301EE711EDB17B3FB1647CE606","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"3":{"type":"safety","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"cij4m","text":"WARNING: Formaldehyde is a carcinogen and should be used in a chemical fume hood.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8mako","text":"Use forceps to remove whole seedlings from the plate and submerge them in the 4% formaldehyde then leave to fix for  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":116,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7p3ne","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2ssso","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"a4amr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":1800,"guid":"36DFC0001EE911EDB17B3FB1647CE606","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"safety","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6dt49","text":"WARNING: Formaldehyde is a carcinogen and should be used in a chemical fume hood.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"em2rk","text":"Move seedlings into a fresh petri dish and carry out three washes with 1 x PBS. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1gpm0","text":"Arrange 3 plants on a slide, place a  No 1 coverslip on top. Then, starting at the root tip, squash each seedling  flat using a pencil eraser. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a6036","text":"Whilst holding the seedlings under the coverslip with forceps, carefully immerse in liquid nitrogen for  . ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":104,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"aa842","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":10,"guid":"186CF3401EE911EDB17B3FB1647CE606","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ejhp","text":"Immediately after the slide is removed from the liquid nitrogen, flip off the coverslip using a razor blade and carefully scape away the frozen leaves. Leave the slide to air dry for   at  . ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":183,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":188,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4s3li","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":3600,"guid":"109273C01EE911EDB17B3FB1647CE606","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"098026401EE911EDB17B3FB1647CE606","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":32}}}}

RNA FISH probes are shipped dry and can be stored at +2 to   in this state. Dissolved probe mix should e subjected to a minimum number of freeze-thaw cycles. For daily and short-term use of dissolved probe mix, storage at +2 to   in the dark up to a month is recommended. For storage longer than a month, Stellaris recommend aliquoting and freezing probes in the dark at -15 to   .","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"a5c3l","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"4BB4E4301F0F11EDBBBE0B10333BC804","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"8","unit":10},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"temperature"},"1":{"data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"8A2711201F0F11EDBBBE0B10333BC804","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"8","unit":10},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"temperature"},"2":{"data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"B44AE0D01F0F11EDBBBE0B10333BC804","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-30","unit":10},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"temperature"}}}},"5":{"type":"safety","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bqntl","text":"WARNING: Formamide is a teratogen that is easily absorbed through the skin and should be used in a chemical fume hood.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5m7og","text":"A wide-field fluorescence microscope is required to image single molecules of mRNA. A high numerical aperture (\u003e1.3) and ideally 100x oil-immersion objectives are ideal. Strong light sources, such as a mercury or metal-halide lamp are ideal, but successful imaging has also been achieved with LEDs. Filter sets must be appropriate for the fluorophores. An EM-CCD camera is ideal, but images can be also be obtained using a standard cooled CCD camera that is optimized for low-light level imaging, rather than speed. Z stacks should be set up to fully encompass cell depth and 200 nm steps should be used to provide adequate resolution for analysis.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ctore","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5r6ru","text":" {"blocks":[{"key":"8f1hd","text":"Per cell mRNA counts can be achieved by basic FIJI commands","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"91vel","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"974fa","text":"First carry out a Maximum Z projection of the stack: Image -\u003e Stacks -\u003e Z project (include all slices and select maximum intensity from the drop down menu).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3p7ou","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7e7kd","text":"For automated image analysis it is essential that acquisition is completed carefully so that stacks do not include images above or below the cells. This is because if full stack projection is completed blindly it can allow high intensity out-of-focus light to impair smFISH spot detection.  If max projection is being completed manually, it is worth specifying the exact top and bottom slices to ensure optimal downstream analysis.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5o16q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"51avr","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"citation","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"authors":"Schindelin J, Arganda-Carreras I, Frise E, Kaynig V, Longair M, Pietzsch T, Preibisch S, Rueden C, Saalfeld S, Schmid B, Tinevez JY, White DJ, Hartenstein V, Eliceiri K, Tomancak P, Cardona A","can_edit":1,"date":"1340841600","doi":"https://doi.org/10.1038/nmeth.2019","guid":"49626AD3341F11EE9D4302C0B41BC903","journal":"Nature methods","protocol_id":"0","title":"Fiji: an open-source platform for biological-image analysis."}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"6F7A1A54345211EEAFD10A58A9FEAC02","height":131,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"io_fig1.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/j974bmip7.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/j972bmip7.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/j973bmip7.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/j97zbmip7.webp","width":184}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"r7h9","text":"Leave seeds to germinate and grow for 5 days","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a1dm3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1puje","text":"We apply the Subtract Background command with a 3 pixel rolling ball radius. This radius setting will depend on you camera set up.  We acquire images with 100 x 100 nm pixels so a 3 pixel radius is required to highlight the ~300 nm diameter smFISH spots.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"og9l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"64nh5","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"tuq3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"6F8174F0345211EEAFD10A58A9FEAC02","height":175.0753138075314,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"brob9\",\"text\":\"This window can be opened by selecting Process -\\u003e Subtract Background\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"io_fig8.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/j978bmip7.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/j976bmip7.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/j977bmip7.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/j975bmip7.webp","width":179.58369098712447}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"95b9f","text":"Cell volumes can also be estimated for mRNA concentration measurements (mRNA per μm3):","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":83,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cu3mv","text":"Take the area measurement calculated in step 25 and multiply this by the Z depth","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bc9si","text":"(i.e. the number of Z steps used during image acquisition multiplied by 0.2 μm).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2imgo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c5vl5","text":"Place the slide in a humid, hybridization chamber to the    incubator and leave overnight.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":57,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cdcfg","text":"Note: You can make your own hybridization chamber by covering a 10 cm tissue culture plate with black insulation tape. Then line the base evenly with a flat water-saturated paper towels and apply a single layer of Parafilm on top to provide a dry flat surface for the slides. For more details see: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bah2u","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2h818","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"C0FE2C481EE911ED91FF0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"citation","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"authors":"Duncan S, Olsson TSG, Hartley M, Dean C, Rosa S","can_edit":1,"date":"1492646400","doi":"https://doi.org/10.21769/BioProtoc.2240","guid":"49626CEE341F11EE9D4302C0B41BC903","journal":"Bio-protocol","protocol_id":"0","title":"Single Molecule RNA FISH in Arabidopsis Root Cells."}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5en01","text":"Select the ROI on the manager window and click on measure to open up a results window showing the area (μm2). Be sure to check that the image file has provided FIJI with calibrated data before trusting these values!","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eu8m5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aeokv","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"72koh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"6FCDB588345211EEAFD10A58A9FEAC02","height":188.32181818181826,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"io_fig5.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/j98ubmip7.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/j98sbmip7.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/j98tbmip7.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/j98rbmip7.webp","width":277.6863270777481}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"6FCDB715345211EEAFD10A58A9FEAC02","height":139.6023295454546,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"io_fig4.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/j98ybmip7.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/j98wbmip7.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/j98xbmip7.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/j98vbmip7.webp","width":299.92687988281256}},"2":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"6FCDB8E3345211EEAFD10A58A9FEAC02","height":186.80571428571415,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"1e7os\",\"text\":\"A quick check at the top of the image should confirm whether it is calibrated correctly.\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"io_fig6.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/j984bmip7.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/j982bmip7.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/j983bmip7.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/j98zbmip7.webp","width":267.9590163934424}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"hge0","text":"Use the Find Maxima command with a 1700 prominence setting (with preview selected) to highlight and quantify all mRNA signals in this cell. This setting should be considered as a starting point and will differ depending on the microscope set up and probe set. To determine the appropriate setting, compare no probe control and probe images (these must have been acquired using the same microscope settings.) Determine the lowest prominence level that retains spot detection in your probe images, but ignores almost all non-specific spots in the no probe controls. As a guide, for all our reference probe sets, we quantified mRNA labels using 1700 prominence setting and this detected an average of one non-specific signal every 3-4 cells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4sl92","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"971eu","text":"      ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":4,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2j067","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"6FD8D2CD345211EEAFD10A58A9FEAC02","height":178.96917808219175,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"io_fig11.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/j988bmip7.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/j986bmip7.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/j987bmip7.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/j985bmip7.webp","width":173.61794019933552}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"6FD8D46F345211EEAFD10A58A9FEAC02","height":182.27756653992392,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"dvefr\",\"text\":\"By preselecting the cell area, maxima are only counted in this area.\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"io_fig12.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/j99cbmip7.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/j99abmip7.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/j99bbmip7.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/j989bmip7.webp","width":159.265780730897}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ftb0r","text":"When imaging suitable transgenic lines it is worth checking whether GFP signal has been retained. Below is an example image showing MON1 mRNA in a cell expressing GFP under a 35S promoter.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":132,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5b6v0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dqdut","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c9lc4","text":"   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":1,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2lesk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"6FDE93B2345211EEAFD10A58A9FEAC02","height":158,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"35S_GFP_Fig_Protocols_io.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/j99gbmip7.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/j99ebmip7.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/j99fbmip7.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/j99dbmip7.webp","width":550}}}}
